original_title: Shirley MacLaine: Gypsy in My Soul
overview: Musical Special featuring Shirley MacLaine in her tribute to chorus dancers, colloquially known as "gypsies."  Produced by Cy Coleman and Fred Ebb, the special uses a self-referential show business plot  in which the star  rehearses for her television special about the life of a dancer. MacLaine performed a wide range of songs including "Lucy's Back in Town," during which Lucille Ball made a "surprise" appearance. The program won Outstanding Special: Comedy-Variety or Music at that year's Emmys as well as awards for writing (Ebb), music composition (Coleman), and choreography (Tony Charmoli).
tagline: Shirley MacLaine offers a tribute to chorus dancers.
title: Shirley MacLaine: Gypsy in My Soul
